title: Bruce Willis Die Hard With a Vengeance - Original Soundtrack + C
description:
Die Hard With A Vengeance: Original Motion Picture Soundtrack 

Audio CD (May 23, 1995) 
Original Release Date: May 19, 1995 
Format: Soundtrack 

+ Covers


Track Listings
1. Summer in the City - Michael Kamen, Boone, Steve  
2. Goodbye Bonwits  
3. Got It Covered  
4. John & Zeus  
5. In Front of the Kids  
6. Papaya King  
7. Take A-Nother Train  
8. The Iron Foundry  
9. Waltz of the Bankers  
10. Gold Vault  
11. Surfing in the Aquaduct  
12. Symphony No. 1 (4th Movement) - Michael Kamen, Brahms  
13. Symphony No. 9 (4th Movement) - Michael Kamen, Beethoven, Ludwig V
...................................................................................  


This is a very odd, blended, and wacko compilation of songs!

Well I&#039;ve seen the movie. When I start watching I see a New York city in red. Then the "Summer In The City" song starts playing and this is a good song, but then I listen to the rest. "Surfing In The Aquaduct" and "In Front Of The Kids" are just slow, dreary rap songs which blur along. "The Ants Go Marching" is a mood-setter and is really good but when on a soundtrack, on it&#039;s own, it starts to fall behind. In the movie it all fits in. Even Beethoven or Mozart or whoever are in there but theydon&#039;t wreck it because they&#039;re old. Even though the Die Hard With A Vengeance Soundtrack was a bit slow, and it only had a few good ( but old ) songs, I thought they didn&#039;t need to be picked on. If they come from the movie, and they fit the movie, and the movie is good, who cares whhther it&#039;s a bad soundtrack or not. Get along.
...................................................................................

nesperi
